thread.title: Officials ID driver wanted in wild gas station crash in DeKalb
thread.title_full: Officials ID driver wanted in wild gas station crash in DeKalb

author: Lauren Foreman
title: Officials ID driver wanted in wild gas station crash in DeKalb
text:
The Georgia State Patrol on Tuesday identified a man they say took off from a traffic stop, crashed into a DeKalb County gas station sign, ran from the scene and left a 7-year-old girl behind.
RELATED: Cops: Girl ejected, left at scene as driver runs from gas station crash
Kadeem D'Anto Fletcher, 25, of Decatur, is wanted on multiple charges, including speeding, reckless driving, fleeing and attempting to elude an officer, hit-and-run, driving unlicensed and serious injury by vehicle, the agency said.
About 7:20 a.m. Monday, a GSP trooper attempted to pull him over on I-20 near Memorial Drive, but as the officer tried to make the stop, Fletcher allegedly faked pulling over and drove away, the GSP said.
The trooper chased Fletcher on I-20 eastbound before losing track of him. Fletcher sped off in a 2011 Audi on the I-20 exit ramp to Gresham Road, jumped the curb, crashed into the sign at the Gresham Road Texaco and knocked it down, Channel 2 Action News reported.
Police said the driver left a child inside the car after the crash. www.accessatlanta.com “The trooper was unable to make the exit ... but noticed smoke, moved over to the shoulder and backed up to the Gresham Road exit,” the GSP said.
Surveillance footage shows the Audi flipped over, narrowly missing an SUV, before crashing.
The girl, identified Tuesday as Serenity Largie of Decatur, was ejected from the Audi and taken to Children’s Healthcare of Atlanta at Egleston. Her relationship to Fletcher and her condition were not released.
Fletcher is 5-foot-8, weighs about 165 pounds and has black hair and brown eyes, the GSP said.
Anyone with information about his whereabouts is asked to contact police.
